instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H_RTC: What is PP3V3_G3H_RTC? PP3V3_G3H_RTC Is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..
definitions.3V3_G3H_RTC: What is 3V3_G3H_RTC? 3V3_G3H_RTC Is an abbreviation of PP3V3_G3H_RTC which is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> One of ports not charging.
threads.message:
Got this board absolutly dead.

<TRANSISTOR>Q3100</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q3200</TRANSISTOR> was heating up while trying to boot. Replaced them and also removed and replaced shorted <CAPACITOR>C7034</CAPACITOR>. Now computer works fine.except of one of ports.  It is <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> Port getting 5V and 0 AMPS. Alreday tried to replace it from donor board but no changes.

On <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> is missing  <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> (not shorted)

P.S:  <SIGNAL>PP1V1_IPC_XA_LDO_BMC</SIGNAL> also missing

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> One of ports not charging.
threads.message:
Broken trace; it comes TO <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>, not FROM.
Use boardview and make a bypass.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> One of ports not charging.
threads.message:
this line:  <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL>  ? 

I cannot find where it comes from.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> One of ports not charging.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> One of ports not charging.
threads.message:
There is continuity from <RESISTOR>R6979</RESISTOR> to <CAPACITOR>C3100</CAPACITOR>. As i told there is only 1 port failing. Even when i boot with good port <CAPACITOR>C3100</CAPACITOR> is getting correcto voltage. 

May be than CD32 bad reballed/soldered

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> One of ports not charging.
threads.message:
"On <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> is missing  <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL>
-------------
There is continuity from <RESISTOR>R6979</RESISTOR> to <CAPACITOR>C3100</CAPACITOR>. "
You've said that; what is actual situation?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> One of ports not charging.
threads.message:
the key is: it is missing only when connect charger to second port (which is used for DFU) then when i have a problema. 

First port is working fine.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> One of ports not charging.
threads.message:
You've first said no <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> present at <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>.
Then said <CAPACITOR>C3100</CAPACITOR> has conitnuity with <RESISTOR>R6979</RESISTOR>.
I expected you to explain that...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> One of ports not charging.
threads.message:
That is exactly what happening. Just add the detail about which port is connected charger. 


When i connect charger to: 


Port 1 (near corner): all is working fine, getting all lines, booting mac, charging and getting all ines on both <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP>
Port 2 (used for DFU) not getting  <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL>  and  <SIGNAL>PP1V1_IPC_XA_LDO_BMC</SIGNAL>  

Already changed <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> twice and this is the question: if still not getting  <SIGNAL>PP1V1_IPC_XA_LDO_BMC</SIGNAL>  and <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> it only can be bad soldered or deffective <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> One of ports not charging.
threads.message:
You didn't specify that <CAPACITOR>C3100</CAPACITOR> missing voltage ONLY when connect charger to its port.
<CAPACITOR>C3100</CAPACITOR> must get voltage from the other port too.

Do you get the other 3 LDOs voltages from <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>?
Compare diode mode readings with <CHIP>U3200</CHIP>.
